FFMNSVJgIIkG8LVZaTSfZg.text: This used to be my local Wendy's back in the day and I used to frequent it a bit too regularly for the Spicy Chicken Sandwich.  I don't really recommend fast-food or chains but I have fond memories at this particular one.  Gotta luv using french fries as a fork for your frostee and seeing it partially melt around the fry.

qsH8-xDPwhD-Wo0_iOLDMg.text: the drive thru line is always too long and moves too slowly. sometimes cars are stuck on Baum blvd. also, the service is slow and poor.

zBaDdtOphZLhBJI7MOeZSg.text: Went here after dinner to grab a frosty but gave up after an extended wait. The cashiers were busy chatting with their friends and couldn't be bothered to help anyone in line. The location also seemed a bit sketchy; I'd avoid this one. Try Panera Bread across the street.

dMi4jsdmKuiyObwQd9Gjrw.text: Since the remodel and reopening, the service and wait time have definitely gotten better. Sure, they're busy at lunch and dinner but that is to be expected. It looks so much nicer inside and the employees are friendlier.

vXNnaAV4JkjPY2xVcsraaA.text: I visisted this Wendy's often when I first started working nearby in Shadyside. But I quickly learned my lesson. I got tired of spending 20 minutes of my lunch break waiting in line. No less than 20 minutes. Every. Single. Time. The drive-thru is only slightly faster at 10-15 mins. Plus, the staff is rude. I've driven out of my way a few times to the Wendy's in Wilkinsburg just to avoid this place.  Anyway, I have no qualms with the food, as it's the same as any other Wendy's. So it's fine if you have time to kill.

pA1w4wqJpukeCyGRoyP4eg.text: Fast food.... NOT.  Big corporate America places only get one shot w us. We came here cause we got stuff to do, quick trip to TARGET, try to get child fed quickly and to bed on time. SO LETS STOP AT Wendy's, right? Quick?  Swing and miss. Never again.

rKAc_9g0Q6RjnZ6r53YhXA.text: Worst Wendy's ever! Probably the slowest service and the worst un educated staff. Not only the slowest service but all of the orders were wrong. Multiple people came inside from the drive-through. I would eat wood chips with milk before I go back to this Wendy's

D7zHOPrE_wDMXOEt3v0uow.text: Tanesia screwed up my drive-through order. The receipt was correct but one order of fries was missing. When I got home I saw that I hadn't received what I'd paid for so I called. I requested that $2.19 be credited back to my credit card but the person with whom I spoke refused to do so unless I drove there in person. I replied that I had no intention of wasting more time and would dispute the charge with my credit card company.  I can't recommend this poorly run restaurant. There are many other options nearby.

h23LeYNyV_fefRGbq028Zg.text: So...a friend and I had been over at Shadyside hospital all day visiting someone. and had a yearning for wendy;s (generally quality food, good prices and we admire the committment to help adoptees) anywhere we got there after the dining room closed. the take out window was open. we found out that even though no sign indicates such, you need a car to use the take out window so after ordering and being told they couldn't give us the food instead of getting the car out of the hospital garage just to use the wendy's take out and then parking again we went to subway. so they lost business and probably had to throw the food away that was already prepared.

d-uUpz6nV1svxaE3SAM56A.text: I was always a McDonalds person, the burgers are better out here. But this sweet thing that kid did for me made me a Wendy's person today, I told him I need a bag, he gave me a whole cardboard box, I swear that kid was so sweet, I then told him I just need a takeaway bag. My first yelp review goes out to you my friend. Cheers. You are the reason I'm becoming a Wendy's guy. I will edit this review the next time I come and ask for your name.

Y0rQUodZBKRVOz44zi68xg.text: In a pinch, Wendy's can do.  However, if you're in a hurry, and expect to use the drive-thru and get out, go elsewhere.  That is also a good sign, shows that the place has staying power with the constant line of people inside and outside wanting their food.  Bad thing, traffic can sometimes be snarled if there is that big of a line that it comes out onto Baum Blvd.  Quick sidenote: if you decide to use the drive-thru, be sure to have used the bathroom prior, not fun to sit there waiting when you really need to use the facilities.  It's like that long ride on the turnpike when you already passed the last rest stop for 50 miles.

8Jqmx_Vs_FTTGabWtvA2xQ.text: I mean, if you lock the doors before 12:30am and have the drive-through open, it would make sense to have enough staff left so that people aren't sitting in the drive-through line for more than 20 minutes.. Can't vouch for the food yet but man this wait is ridculous.

yBFtTjiJagaTTl-pC4K0qw.text: A couple blocks away from the UPMC Shadyside hospital, this was one of the better Wendy's experiences I have had.  Friendly staff working at a fast clip at the inside counter.   I got a spicy chicken medium combo with small chili and sweet tea. I also picked up the $1 frosty keychain tag of which 0.80 goes to the Salvation Army and gets me a free mini-frosty with subsequent visits.  They didn't try to upsell me or read me the rule book when I asked for extra hot chili sauce (my favorite hot sauce of any fast food chain) and crackers like the Wendy's at home.  Food was fresh and hot. Can't ask for more from a Wendy's.

photos.caption: Photo of Wendy's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Wendy's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

PlhcHCao_-EuQd1QAkE4Lg.text: This location just reopened, and it is shockingly beautiful for a fast-food joint. Giant glass windows give a peek inside to the revamped interior, complete with the fancy-schmancy create-your-own-Coke machine. We got our order to go, and service was super pleasant and expedient, although the dining room closes at 10pm which means that the drive-thru line gets backed up onto Baum come 10:15pm. We'll see if hours adjust based on demand. In the meantime, it's the cleanest place to have "quick" food on Baum/Centre!

WS9n7IUG4FGxcE-nik0Y3g.text: Perhaps it is due to my experiences in dtown Balto that I may have a skewed opinion, but anyone who tries to say that this location has shady patrons is woefully incorrect.  As of today, I have gone to this location throughout every part of the day.  Today, sunday morning, I walked into the fast food joint while half the restaurant was blocked off for prospective vibrant wendy's employees training.  their overplayed commercial promoting their breakfast, specifically their "fresh cracked eggs cooked on a griddle" thing, finally inspired me to wake up before noon for the first time in a while to head to wendy's for breakfast.  I got the artisan egg sandwich with sausage combo (which includes their roasted potato slices and a drink (OJ costs 80 cents extra)).  I thought that the roasted potato slices would turn out too gourmet, which i was NOT looking for.  But praise whatever you'd like me to praise, they did use a good amount of starch to give it the outside crunch reminiscent of a french fry or a tator tot.  thumbs up to that.  unfortunately, i may have come too late to get the fresh batch of sausage patties, but mine came out a bit dry.  Then why 5 stars? the 99 cent junior bacon cheeseburger.  my goodness, it could be the best 99 cent fast food item of all time.  i've ordered as many as 6 at once before, and no more than 1 was made with any type of cheese translational misregistration relative to the sausage patty substrate (did i just reveal my identity as a loser? i hope not). in layman's terms, every little cheeseburger came out constructed perfectly, with one slice of fresh tomato, crisp green lettuce, and most importantly, their bacon.  overall, i'm partially thankful to be in pittsburgh because of how near i live to this wendy's, and because pittsburgh is one of only around four metropolitan areas where wendy's currently offers breakfast. although nothing would ever match up to in n out, this is my go-to place to satiate my cravings i get as a socal fast-food junkie.

photos.caption: Photo of Wendy's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. artisan egg sandwich with sausage, wendy&#39;s own take on potato carbs for breakfast, and OJ

pqiDBDxXgaah36oJTmTCFA.text: Worst Wendy's I have ever had. The line of cars for the drive thru was into the street yet when we got our food everything was cold. Nothing was fresh. The night crew obviously does not care to do their jobs and provide any kind of good service or decent food.

06AelOOA0u-wY4dfiCPURA.text: I will forever remember this drive-through conversation:  Welcome to Wendy's. Can I take your order?  Yeah, I'd like a Frescuit.   We ain't got no hashbrowns!  ...um, all I want it a Frescuit.   A'ight... I'm just lettin' you know.

sdaNWMVVWFNiP5ZBsb11-Q.text: The slowest Wendy's I've ever been to. 20 minutes in the drive thru is crazy for "fast food".

JaLMbKLOO6w8gtefGwtl-g.text: what is it with Wendys ?  They never get the orders right. If any of the employees would smile I would die from shock.  This review applies to many of the Wendys  that I have been to. Even in Florida.  Do they train them to be rude and ignorant ?

fm-BTHxlUU7-LWW-VDaMRg.text: This Wendy's is one of the slower ones I've experienced. Their food is pretty much the same as any other Wendy's you'll go to, the difference is that it takes a lot more time to get your food at this Wendy's. They always seem understaffed and no matter the number of people in line, it always takes forever. I'm going to avoid it in the future because if I want to wait for my food, I'll go somewhere with higher quality food!

qqHa2g9edHNzHjcXWnIdVQ.text: This place is pretty hit or miss. On a good day, the food is fresh and delicious, and the staff is friendly and polite. On a bad day, nothing comes out the way it should and the frostys even suck. How can a Wendy's mess up a frosty? I have no clue.   I did just discover that their morning potatoes are better than McD's hashbrown patty, an accomplishment that I did not think was possible - the crispy little polygons are spiced to delicious perfection and are a great compliment to the square (ciabatta-eqsue?) sausage muffin. Morning heartburn? Yes, but probably worth it, and also the reason Tums exist.

2sdq7eMPBMe6j4X1AybM6Q.text: Consistently some of the slowest fast food service I've ever been witness to. Expect to wait at least 20 minutes - every time - just to place your order. Then, you'll be lucky if the order is actually correct and even luckier if it's still hot.  It doesn't mater if you go inside or to the drive thru. It's happened to me enough times that I'm actually writing a yelp review about it... which I don't generally do.

YyvW1YQXaQ_cgBUEuHwZVw.text: Worst wait times ever, staff is inefficient. It doesnt matter if the store if updated with a fancy facade, wait times average 15 minutes to 40 minutes for drive through during peak times. If youre going to run a fast food joint the keyword is "fast"

BlROrHmcD3L9yHoU95hz4w.text: This place is well -sanitized and has enough space to host lots of customers on rush hours. It even has wonderful terrace seats. You know that it's very hard to find that kind of virtues around here.   Wendy's cheese burger is definitely delicious. Its patty is so juicy and breads are soft. Drink option is cool, too. You can have free ice tea in side bar.  My only complaint is the size of burger. Isn't it too small?????? I am an Asian girl and don't eat too much but still..... I wasn't satisfied with the amount of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Wendy's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Too small amount of potatoes and single cheeseburgers

u9kawgdPmEg8qJCjqZutbA.text: Dirty, sticky surfaces all over. Urine pooled on the bathroom floor. Slow, inaccurate service.  I used to get lunch here regularly but the service is so slow and the sticky floors just gross me out.

TGkMxbarSlnFOKh_U0-3VA.text: Wendy's food tastes like Wendy's no matter where you go but it's not worth it here.  The inside is gorgeous and new, but it's not enough for the service.  I've been here multiple times and the wait is always slow, it doesn't matter if you go during an off time and there is only one person waiting in front of you.  The wait was so long sitting in my car, that I've parked and tried going in to see if the service would move faster.  It did not.  On my last visit, one of the workers shouted at the top of her lungs and generally wandered around.  At one point, she dumped frozen french fries into the fryer and arranged them without gloves on.  I'm not entirely sure if it matters since it's going into the fryer, but it wasn't great as a customer to witness.  I enjoyed my last nuggets here after that one.

P1zsyB3ZR4z5RtXwaJdJog.text: Atrocious service in the drive thru. Placed a mobile order only for them to ask me my name and full order after a 20 minute wait. I was shouted at by a snippy woman. Can't eat the food obviously because I'm sure they spit in it and that's how you get hero HepC

W2JaJGvsE7l-oFbK-iIk-Q.text: Today is the first time I've ever come here. Horrible customer service and upkeep of eating area and bathroom. Disgustingly dirty. Ridiculously slow. The bathroom has urine all over the seat and floor. There's juice all over the floor. The area has cup lids and straws all over the place. The employees move with no effort. This place undermines the meaning of "fast food".

photos.caption: Photo of Wendy's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

R3Kf65tH40OUm-OzTUfahQ.text: Zeros stars. This Wendy's on Baum is INSANE. Both drive thru line and inside are a mess. Customer behind me after waiting twenty mins honked horn so loud it hurt my ears. Waited twenty minutes in drive thru, had to pull away without checking my food since I had somewhere to be and fast food is supposed to be fast. paid $7 and got the wrong meal of two small fries and two single burgers, aka like $4. Waisted my time and money. I come here like once every four months and something stupid like this happens every time.

STOSXABEO2vSa-D8xlFsvw.text: I thought I saw a girl working the drive thru window take a picture of my credit card the other day but I figured I was being paranoid so I didn't say anything. Later that night $800 in unauthorized charges showed up. Contacted Wendy's but all they said was the video showed her with a cell phone out but proved nothing else so the worker is still there!  Do NOT support this business!! Police are involved.

9B-O52uXPM5BlkppK7V95Q.text: The food is always great, but the wait is another story. I waited for 30+ minutes at the drive-thru. While I was waiting at the window, I noticed 2 girls screaming and doing nothing as well as another girl on her phone next to the window the five minutes I was at the window. The cashier seemed to keep busy. Good on them.

Z3uClfjVOMt3oX3Qs4Qn-g.text: Didn't get a chance to order.  This place always has the slowest drive-thru, so we decided to go inside.  There were three people standing behind the counter and not one of them looked in our direction or said they would be with us.  There were maybe three or four people waiting for their orders and no one else in line.  We ended up leaving and going to Wendy's on McKnight, which was a whole different can of worms.  Wendy's has gone down hill.

eATqRGBz_wLdTTOMwQVmwA.text: This Wendy's location is horrific. Even after the remodel, the service is terrible. I've only gone here twice in the past few years and both times the drive thru took over 20 minutes. The most recent time took over 30 minutes and I was only the 4th car in line. No one apologized, no one asked me to park and wait for food, nothing. It should not take 20+ minutes in a drive thru every time.

photos.caption: Photo of Wendy's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I had turned off my engine while waiting at the speaker to order.

5vRKWLhqCl6R2_Bwmc9WdA.text: Mediocre service,  lots of people behind the counter, but too many just standing around.

7DVxNL5VmRP8Kxo8S2EcAg.text: The food was typical of a Wendy's (I got the GJBC meal). However, the service was subpar. We went through the drive thru and ended up with a small meal when we wanted the large. We were relatively sure we specified that we wanted a large, but even if we did not, the employee never asked us if we wanted a large meal. Also, when handing us our drinks through the window, it tilted so much that the cap definitely could've fell off.

3vAwK2V5tY6DBoDRdusI7w.text: So they remodeled and it looks super cool, wide open, bright. Wifi and high top tables you can pull up to, plug in, and look out to the busy street... But I honestly think everyone working this shift MUST be high..  Slow doesn't even begin to describe the Neutral gear this restaurant was moving in... Very strange... Perhaps the full moon?

OiP8kYnE6bxnMflFzxFIzQ.text: I love Wendy's chili and while some things are worth the wait, it is hard to categorize this location as fast food.  This is quite a convenient location and would fare better with some more attention to detail.

BOgRc73o3d2CoVyIp7zmuQ.text: The Guinness book of world records needs to visit this location to verify my suspicion that this is perhaps the slowest drive through experience you will ever receive, regardless of when you come, or what you order... It will be very slow... You will sit in the parking lot and watch in amazement as three or four employees sit at tables in the (closed) dining room area and text people. Perhaps they are excited about the nomination they will receive for slowest possible service... Or maybe they are texting the one person in the back and letting them know that they need to get the line moving because traffic has extended onto the street... Make sure you are in the right lane after you pass through the intersection because it is highly likely you will begin your long journey to the order window on the actual street in front of this Wendy's, one star because the order was semi-accurate.

R08jgvwC3YmVhEGN31GWIg.text: I usually drive-thru this Wendy's but this particular day I didn't feel like waiting in the long line that seemed never-ending lin, so I went in. First, this Wendy's is huge compared to others, and it's really nice inside. However, it's not clean. I couldn't believe that I was pulling my drink lid from a metal sever that had disgusting stains and hair on it. The condiment table was equally nasty with loose lids and ketchup. The dining area did not appear that clean either. Lastly, they have those wonderful virtual soda machines, but many of the options were unavailable. Let's just say I'll probably be sticking to the drive-thru from now on.

azt9tsvXtJzS2TVzcz-nuQ.text: Threw up from Wendy's twice in one week.  Once in a year, okay.  Twice in one week, no more for me.  While the service was constantly slow, and the orders were sometimes wrong, I never thought that their incompetence was so severe that it would affect the actual quality of the food.  I was wrong.  BE CAREFUL PGH!!!

rdqufFhvBf9gEZVMEsNgCA.text: Aw Wendys.. You get no love? Okay in everyones defense service is spotty. But c'mon. That frosty itself deserves atleast 2 stars :) (5 IMO)  Funny story. 1/1/14 @ 3am. We just left Southside & were driving around aimlessly looking for places to eat. At last we spot Wendys & a drive thru line wrapped around. We wait.. & wait & wait. A few cars leave & we move. & wait some more. Finally we decide to leave after realizing it'll take forever to get through the line. We drive past the window & boom.. It's dark & closed. We look at the Wendys sign which states they close at 6pm new years eve. So a line of 20 cars including us all had a dummy moment the very beginning of 2014, including our DD. haha :)

u0AmCVkiU4EQ37sf5ANRRg.text: Always check your food cuz usually it's wrong I got a drink and didn't even give me a straw the one time I got a frosty they didn't give me a spoon I asked for ketchup they give me one packet but other than that the food is usually good I haven't had a problem getting bad food but like I said check it always cuz usually it's wrong or they forget something they also forgot to give me my debit card back the one time also I paid with a $50 bill one time and got three things off the dollar menu gave exact change and she tried saying that I gave her a $20 bill that was kind of shady to me needless to say that girl no longer works there they had to fire her after that because it was done multiple times I found that out because my friend also works at Wendy's

anRL3xbJ4e6uuNiKK-8ZFw.text: This has got to be one of the slowest Wendy's on the planet. I just spent 15 minutes in the drive thru with only 3 other cars
